Class CoordinateBridge

java.lang.Object
org.jscience.geography.CoordinateBridge
public final class CoordinateBridge extends Object
Bridge utility for converting between Coordinate (social geography) and GeodeticCoordinate (scientific geodesy).

This class provides conversion methods to seamlessly work with both coordinate representations depending on the use case.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Silvere Martin-Michiellot, Gemini AI (Google DeepMind)

  • Method Details

    • toGeodetic

      public static GeodeticCoordinate toGeodetic(Coordinate coordinate)
      Converts a social geography Coordinate to a scientific GeodeticCoordinate.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - the social geography coordinate
      Returns:
      equivalent geodetic coordinate using WGS84 ellipsoid

    • toGeodetic

      public static GeodeticCoordinate toGeodetic(Coordinate coordinate, ReferenceEllipsoid ellipsoid)
      Converts a social geography Coordinate to a GeodeticCoordinate with specified reference ellipsoid.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - the social geography coordinate
      ellipsoid - the reference ellipsoid to use
      Returns:
      equivalent geodetic coordinate

    • fromGeodetic

      public static Coordinate fromGeodetic(GeodeticCoordinate geodetic)
      Converts a scientific GeodeticCoordinate to a social geography Coordinate.
      Parameters:
      geodetic - the geodetic coordinate
      Returns:
      equivalent social geography coordinate

    • geodeticFromDegrees

      public static GeodeticCoordinate geodeticFromDegrees(double latitudeDegrees, double longitudeDegrees, double altitudeMeters)
      Creates a GeodeticCoordinate from latitude/longitude in degrees.
      Parameters:
      latitudeDegrees - latitude in degrees
      longitudeDegrees - longitude in degrees
      altitudeMeters - altitude in meters
      Returns:
      geodetic coordinate using WGS84

    • haversineDistance

      public static double haversineDistance(Coordinate from, Coordinate to)
      Calculates the distance between two coordinates using the standard Haversine calculation.
      Parameters:
      from - starting coordinate
      to - ending coordinate
      Returns:
      distance in meters
